data.name: ColumnEditorDialogCompilationError
CommandBlocked
data.value: Sorry, but I can't do that

data.name: CommandLineHelp
data.value:
GRINDSTONE [drive:][path][filename] [options]
[drive:][path][filename] Specifies drive, directory, and name of a database file to open
Options:
-i, --install starts the install process
-u, --uninstall starts the uninstall process
-s, --silent causes the install/uninstall process to proceed silently with minimal options
--createDesktopShortcut causes the install process to create a Desktop short-cut when silent
--leaveConfiguration causes the uninstall process not to remove the configuration when silent
--removeDatabases causes the uninstall process to remove databases when silent
--startWhenFinished causes the install process to launch Grindstone after finishing when silent
--startWithWindows causes the install process to set Grindstone to run at start-up when silent
--exportLocalization:path saves all text for the current locale in the JSON runtime format in the directory located at path

data.name: DatabaseCreationDialogEncryptEUA
data.value: The first time you open this database, you will be asked to set the password. On each subsequent time it is opened, the same password must be entered.

data.name: DatabaseCreationDialogNameIllegalCharacters
data.value: Must not contain invalid characters for file names

data.name: DatabaseSelectionDialogDeleteConfirmation
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the "{0}" database? This is not reversible!

data.name: DatabaseSelectionDialogDeleteFailed
data.value: I was unable to delete the "{0}" database Could it currently be in use? If so, please switch to another database or close Grindstone before attempting to delete the "{0}" database.

data.name: EULAText
data.value:
SHORT DESCRIPTION
You are granted a non-exclusive license to use Grindstone for any purposes for an unlimited period of time. Grindstone is provided free of charge.
Even though a license fee is not paid for the use of Grindstone, it does not mean that there are no conditions for using it:
1. You may install and use Grindstone for any legal purpose.
2. You may install and use Grindstone on any number of systems.
3. You may copy and distribute Grindstone under the condition that original copyright notice and disclaimer of warranty will stay intact, and you will not charge money or fees for Grindstone, except to cover distribution costs.
4. You will not have any proprietary rights in and to Grindstone. You acknowledge and agree that Epiforge retains all copyrights and other proprietary rights in and to Grindstone.
5. Use within the scope of this license is free of charge and you shall pay no royalty or licensing fees.
FULL VERSION
Please, read this carefully. By using all or any portion of the Software you accept all the terms and conditions of this Agreement. If you do not agree, do not use this Software.
1. DEFINITIONS
When used in this Agreement, the following terms shall have the respective meanings indicated, such meanings to be applicable to both the singular and plural forms of the terms defined:
“Licensor” means Epiforge Software, LLC.
“Licensee” means You or Your Company, unless otherwise indicated.
“Software” means (a) all of the contents of the files, disk(s), CD-ROM(s) or other media with which this Agreement is provided, including but not limited to ((i) registration information, i.e. License key which is unique for a registration name of the Licensee; (ii) related explanatory written materials or files (“Documentation”); and (iii) Software setup files and code samples (if any); and (b) upgrades, modified versions, updates, additions, and copies of the Software, if any, licensed to you by Epiforge Software, LLC (collectively, “Updates”).
“Use” or “Using” means to access, install, download, copy or otherwise benefit from using the functionality of the Software in accordance with the Documentation.
“System” means Windows, GNU/Linux, macOS, Android, iOS, or any virtual machine.
2. GENERAL USE
You are granted a non-exclusive License to Use the downloaded Software for any purposes for an unlimited period of time.
The software product under this License is provided free of charge. Even though a license fee is not paid for the use of such software, it does not mean that there are no conditions for using such software.
2.1. The Software may be installed and Used by the Licensee for any legal purpose.
2.2. The Software may be installed and Used by the Licensee on any number of systems.
2.3. The Software can be copied and distributed under the condition that original copyright notice and disclaimer of warranty will stay intact and the Licensee will not charge money or fees for the Software product, except to cover distribution costs.
2.4. The Licensee will not have any proprietary rights in and to the Software. The Licensee acknowledges and agrees that the Licensor retains all copyrights and other proprietary rights in and to the Software.
2.5 Use within the scope of this License is free of charge and no royalty or licensing fees shall be paid by the Licensee.
3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS
3.1 This License does not transmit any intellectual rights on the Software. The Software and any copies that the Licensee is authorized by the Licensor to make are the intellectual property of and are owned by the Licensor.
3.2 The Software is protected by copyright, including without limitation by Copyright Law and international treaty provisions.
3.3 Any copies that the Licensee is permitted to make pursuant to this Agreement must contain the same copyright and other proprietary notices that appear on or in the Software.
3.4 The structure, organization and code of the Software are the valuable trade secrets and confidential information of the Licensor. The Licensee agrees not to decompile, disassemble or otherwise attempt to discover the source code of the Software.
3.5 Any attempts to reverse-engineer, copy, clone, modify or alter in any way the installer program without the Licensor’s specific approval are strictly prohibited. The Licensee is not authorized to use any plug-in or enhancement that permits to save modifications to a file with software licensed and distributed by the Licensor.
3.6 Trademarks shall be used in accordance with accepted trademark practice, including identification of trademarks owners’ names. Trademarks can only be used to identify printed output produced by the Software and such use of any trademark does not give the Licensee any rights of ownership in that trademark.
4. WARRANTY
4.1 The Licensor warrants that:
4.1.1 The Licensor owns the Software and documentation and/or is in possession of valid and existing licenses that support the terms of this Agreement;
4.1.2 the Software conforms to specifications and functionality as specified in Documentation;
4.1.3 to the best of the Licensor’s knowledge, the Software does not infringe upon or violate any intellectual property right of any third party;
4.1.4 the Software does not contain any routine, intentionally designed by the Licensor to disable a computer program, or computer instructions that may alter, destroy or inhibit the processing environment.
4.2 Except those warranties specified in section 4.1 above, the Software is being delivered to the Licensee “AS IS” and the Licensor makes no warranty as to its use or performance.
The Licensor does not and cannot warrant the performance or results the Licensee may obtain by using the Software. The entire risk arising out of use or performance of the Software remains with the Licensee.
The Licensor gives no warranty, express or implied, that (i) the Software will be of satisfactory quality, suitable for any particular purpose or for any particular use under specified conditions, notwithstanding that such purpose, use, or conditions may be known to the Licensor; or (ii) that the Software will operate error free or without interruption or that any errors will be corrected.
5. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
In no event will the Licensor be liable for any damages, claims or costs whatsoever or any consequential, indirect, incidental damages, or any lost profits or lost savings, even if the Licensor has been advised of the possibility of such loss, damages, claims or costs or for any claim by any third party.
In no event will the Licensee be liable to the Licensor on condition that the Licensee complies with all terms and conditions stated in this License.
6. NON-WAIVER
If a portion of this agreement is held unenforceable, the remainder shall be valid. It means that if one section of the Agreement is not lawful, the rest of the Agreement is still in force. A party’s failure to exercise any right under this Agreement will not constitute a waiver of (a) any other terms or conditions of this Agreement, or (b) a right at any time thereafter to require exact and strict compliance with the terms of this Agreement.
© 2021 Epiforge Software, LLC. All rights reserved.

data.value: Report critical technical details to Epiforge

data.name: FatalErrorWindowText
data.value: Our most humble apologies, but Grindstone has stumbled upon an error that it was not built to deal with. This error is not your fault. But, you can go beyond the call of duty and help us fix it!

data.name: FatalErrorWindowWhatWereYouDoing
data.value: This happened while I was trying to...

data.name: InstallerWindowEULACondition
data.value: If you accept the terms of the agreement, click or tap Agree to continue. You must accept the agreement to install Grindstone.

data.name: InstallerWindowEULASubheader
data.value: Please review the license terms before installing Grindstone.

data.name: InstallerWindowInstallingSubheader
data.value: Please wait while Grindstone is being installed.

data.name: InstallerWindowOptionsDirections
data.value: Check the options you prefer and uncheck the ones you do not. Click or tap Install to continue.

data.name: InstallerWindowOptionsSubheader
data.value: Choose how you want Grindstone to be installed.

data.name: InstallerWindowUninstallingSubheader
data.value: Please wait while Grindstone is being uninstalled.

data.name: InstallerWindowUninstallOptionsDirections
data.value: Check the options you prefer and uncheck the ones you do not. Click or tap Uninstall to continue.

data.name: InstallerWindowUninstallOptionsSubheader
data.value: Choose how you want Grindstone to be uninstalled.

data.name: InstallerWindowUpdatingSubheader
data.value: Please wait while Grindstone is being updated.

data.name: InstallerWindowWelcomeText
data.value:
Setup will guide you through the installation of Grindstone.
You do not need to close any other applications before starting Setup and you will not be asked to reboot your computer.
Click or tap Next to continue.

data.name: RejectionReasonCannotCreateBuiltInValue
data.value: A change creating a value for a built-in trait was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonCannotDeleteBuiltInTrait
data.value: A change deleting a built-in trait was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonCannotDeleteBuiltInValue
data.value: A change deleting a value for a built-in trait was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonCannotUpdateReadOnlyBuiltInValue
data.value: A change updating a read-only value for a built-in trait was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonEntityCatalogFailed
data.value: A change to create a piece of data succeeded, but the data could not be catalogued.

data.name: RejectionReasonEntityCreationFailed
data.value: A change to create a piece of data failed.

data.name: RejectionReasonEntityCreationInvalidTraitEntityType
data.value: A change creating a trait for a kind of data that could not be found was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonEntityNotFound
data.value: A change to a piece of data that could not be found was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonEntityTypeIdNotFound
data.value: A change to an unknown type of data was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonEntityTypeNotSupported
data.value: A change to an unsupported type of data was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonPreviousTokenMismatch
data.value: A change that modifies something with an intervening modification was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonTraitNotFound
data.value: A trait value change for a trait that could not be found was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonTraitValueNotFound
data.value: A change for a trait value that could not be found was attempted.

data.name: RejectionReasonTraitValueNotProvided
data.value: A change creating a piece of data failed because a required trait value was not provided.

data.name: RejectionReasonTraitValueTypeResolutionFailed
data.value: A change containing a a trait value that could not be understood was attempted.

data.name: SaveLoggedExceptionsNone
data.value: There are no logged exceptions to save.

data.name: StopwatchOperationsDialogDisplayCompilationError
StopwatchOperationsDialogDurationCompilationError
StopwatchOperationsEUA
data.value: Stopwatch operations start from the context of the time slice you're currently timing. If you would like to aggregate information (e.g. count, max, min, sum, etc.) from the assignment, person, work item, or a list value associated with the current time slice, use the appropriate query in context function to indicate the associated entity from which to aggregate.

data.name: ToolTipEncryptDatabase

data.value: Select which database I'm currently using.

data.value: Deliberately throw an exception to test the diagnostic system.

data.name: ViewEditorDialogFilterCompilationError
ViewEditorDialogSystemViewEUA
data.value: This is a system view. Some of its characteristics may not be modified.

data.name: ViewEditorFilterParameterAvailabilityEUA
data.value: New view parameters are not available for use in the filter until the view has been saved at least once.

data.name: ViewEntitiesDirectoryModeAutoSelectEUA
data.value: This is a system view. I use it when I need to make a selection for you automatically. I will pick the first entry in the view that satisfies certain conditions. For example, if you start timing a work item, I will use a view like this to see if there is an already existing assignment to use for timing. If none of the entries match the conditions, I will make a new entry that does and use that one.

data.name: ViewEntitiesDirectoryModeEntityEUA
data.value: This is a system view. I use its first column when I need to show you a list of items. Any changes you make to the column's operation or to the order of entries in the view will be reflected in the lists.

data.name: ViewEntitiesDirectoryModeTraitEUA
data.value: This is a system view. I use its first column when I need to make the fields on a form when you're editing something. Any changes you make to the column's operation or the order of entries will be reflected in the forms. You can also use this view as a starting point for creating new traits; just click the Add Entry button above.

data.name: WarningDecryptDatabase
data.value: If you decrypt your database, anyone with access to your database file will be able to read it without entering a password.

data.name: WarningDeleteColumn
data.value: If you continue, this column will be permanently deleted and will no longer be displayed in the view.

data.name: WarningDeleteEntries
data.value: If you continue, the selected entries will be permanently deleted.

data.name: WarningDeleteView
data.value: If you continue, the currently displayed view and its columns will be permanently deleted. The entries displayed by it will not be deleted.
